column1: French: « Leur comportement thermique n’est pas aussi stable que celui des grandes grottes de la planète qui maintiennent une température constante, mais ils se ressemblent en ce qu’ils sont des trous profonds dans la terre », selon Glen Cushing, membre de l’équipage de l'USGS (Centre américain d’études géologiques) et du personnel de l’Université d’Arizona du Nord situé à Flagstaff, en Arizona. = English:
column2: Their thermal behavior is not as steady as large caves on Earth that often maintain a fairly constant temperature, but it is consistent with these being deep holes in the ground," said Glen Cushing of the United States Geological Survey (USGS) Astrogeology Team and of Northern Arizona University located in Flagstaff, Arizona.
column3: Their thermal behavior is not as stable as that of the deep caves on the planet that maintain a constant temperature, but they resemble each other in that they are deep holes in the ground. column1: French: Et depuis, le gouvernement fédéral a pris les devants en se chargeant du financement du Mersey Hospital à Devonport, en Tasmanie. Le gouvernement d'état et certains parlementaires ont qualifié cet acte de farce à l'approche des élections de novembre. = English:
column2: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November.
column3: And since, the federal government has taken the lead in financing the Mersey Hospital in Devonport, Tasmania. column1: French: Les langues officielles de Barcelone sont le catalan et l'espagnol. Environ la moitié des habitants préfère parler catalan, une grande majorité le comprend, et pratiquement tout le monde est capable de parler espagnol. = English:
column2: Barcelona's official languages are Catalan and Spanish. About a half prefer to speak Catalan, a vast majority understands it, and virtually everyone knows Spanish.
column3: The official languages of Barcelona are Catalan and Spanish. About half of the residents prefer to speak Catalan, a large majority understand it, and almost everyone is able to speak Spanish.  +  +  ==Get in==  +  +  ===By plane===  +  +  Barcelona has two airports, the main one is the Barcelona-El Prat Airport (BCN), which is located about 20 km (12 miles) from the city center. The other one is the Barcelona-Reus Airport (REU), which is located about 50 km (31 miles) from the city center.  +  +  ===By train===  +  +  Barcelona has a very good train network, with trains going to all the major cities in Spain and to other European countries. The main train station is called '''Sants''' and is located in the city center.  +  +  ===By bus===  +  +  There are many bus companies that offer bus services to and from Barcelona. The main bus station is called '''Plaça Catalunya''' and is located in the city center.  +  +  ===By car===  +  +  Barcelona is connected to the rest of Spain by the AP-7 motorway, which runs from the French border to the city. column1: French: Dans les régions intérieures du nord de l'Inde et du Pakistan, le yaourt est couramment utilisé dans les currys ; dans le sud de l'Inde et certaines autres régions côtières du sous-continent, le lait de coco est couramment utilisé. = English:

column1: French: Cela ressemble au ski de randonnée de type alpin, ainsi qu'à l'alpinisme, sans toutefois incorporer en général ces activités, qui se pratiquent sur des terrains accidentés et qui exigent l'utilisation de skis et de bottes beaucoup plus rigides. = English:
column2: It is related to but usually not involving alpine style ski touring or mountaineering, the latter ones done in steep terrain and requiring much stiffer skis and boots.
column3: This resembles alpine skiing, as well as alpinism, without incorporating in general these activities, which are practiced on accident-prone terrain and which require the use of skis and boots much more rigid.  The term "alpinisme" is also used in the context of mountaineering, which is a form of alpinism that involves climbing mountains. column1: French: Les accidents aériens sont fréquents en Iran, qui dispose d'une flotte vieillissante et mal entretenue autant pour les vols civils que militaires. = English:
column2: Air accidents are common in Iran, which has an aging fleet that is poorly maintained both for civil and military operations.
column3: Air accidents are frequent in Iran, which has an old and poorly maintained fleet of both civil and military aircraft.  The accident was the deadliest in Iran since February 2011, when a Caspian Airlines Tupolev Tu-154M crashed in the Zagros Mountains, killing all 168 people on board.  The crash was the deadliest involving a Boeing 737 since a Lion Air Boeing 737-800 crashed into the Java Sea in October 2018, killing 189 people.  See also  List of accidents and incidents involving commercial aircraft List of accidents and incidents involving the Boeing 737  References  External links  Iranian Civil Aviation Organization  Iranian Airlines Flight 752

column1: French: Le déterminisme technologique est un terme qui englobe un large éventail d'idées dans la pratique, allant de la poussée technologique ou de l'impératif technologique à un sens strict selon lequel le destin de l'humanité est dicté par une logique sous-jacente liée aux lois scientifiques et à leur manifestation dans les technologies. = English:

column3: Most cruises on the Baltic Sea have a long stay in Saint Petersburg, Russia.  The Baltic Sea is a marginal sea of the Atlantic Ocean, between Europe and North America. It is connected to the North Sea via the Skagerrak Strait, and to the Atlantic Ocean via the Kattegat and the English Channel. The Baltic Sea is the world's largest estuary, with an area of about 5,400,000 km2 (2,100,000 sq mi). It is bordered by Sweden in the north, Finland in the northwest, Russia in the east, Estonia in the southeast, Latvia in the south, and Germany in the southwest. The Baltic Sea is about 1,200 km (750 mi) long and 580 km (360 mi) wide, with a volume of about 30,000 km3 (7,900 cu mi). The sea is divided into several basins by the Scandinavian Mountains, the Gulf of Bothnia, and the Gulf of Finland. The sea's total area is about 5,400,000 km2 (2,100,000 sq mi), of which about 2,100,000 km2 (770,000 sq mi) is water. The Baltic Sea has an average depth of about 70 m (230 ft). column3: Gothic style reached its apogee between the 12th and the 14th centuries.  The Gothic style is a style of architecture that developed in the 12th and 13th centuries in Western Europe. It is characterized by the use of pointed arches, ribbed vaults, and flying buttresses. The style is named after the Gothic cathedral of Notre-Dame de Paris, which was begun in 1163 and completed in 1345. column1: French: Les pâtisseries aux fruits y sont habituelles : des pommes sont cuites et cuisinées en pâtisserie toute l'année, tandis que cerises et prunes pointent le bout de leur nez en été. = English:
column2: Fruit pastries are common, with apples cooked into pastries year round, and cherries and plums making their appearances during the summer.
column3: Fruit cakes are very common: apples are cooked and cooked in pastry all year round, while cherries and plums point to the end of their noses in summer.  The French word for "fruit cake" is pâtisserie, which is also the word for "pastry". column3: The Giza Plateau, or “Necropolis of Giza”, in the Valley of the Kings in Egypt, contains several pyramids (the Great Pyramid being the largest), many tombs, many temples and the Great Sphinx. column1: French: Le 6 octobre 1789, le roi Louis XVI, la reine Marie-Antoinette, leurs deux jeunes enfants (Marie-Thérèse, 11 ans, et Louis-Charles, 4 ans) et la sœur du roi, madame Élisabeth, tous terrifiés, sont contraints de rentrer à Paris depuis Versailles par une foule de vendeuses. = English:
column2: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
column3: On October 6, 1789, King Louis XVI, Queen Marie-Antoinette, their two young children (Marie-Thérèse, 11 years, and Louis-Charles, 4 years) and the sister of the king, Madame Élisabeth, all terrified, are forced to return to Paris from Versailles by a crowd of vendors.  The painting is in the collection of the Musée du Louvre. column1: French: Un employé d'un garage proche du lieu de l’accident a déclaré : « il y avait des enfants qui cherchaient à traverser la route, et qui criaient et pleuraient. » = English:
column2: A person working in a garage near where the accident occurred said: "There were children waiting to cross the road and they were all screaming and crying."
column3: An employee of a garage near the scene of the accident said: "There were children who were trying to cross the road, and they were crying and screaming."  The accident occurred at the intersection of Route 40 and Route 40A, which is a four-way intersection. The intersection is controlled by a traffic light. The driver of the car was traveling southbound on Route 40, and the driver of the truck was traveling eastbound on Route 40A. The truck was making a left turn onto Route 40 when the car collided with the truck. The truck driver was not injured. The driver of the car was transported to a local hospital, where he was pronounced dead.  The driver of the car was identified as a 17-year-old male from the town of Westport. The driver of the truck was identified as a 48-year-old male from the town of Westport.  The accident is under investigation by the Westport Police Department.  See also  References

column1: French: Ces enfants sont considérés comme « féroces » ou sauvages. column3: The first information about Taiwan dates back to the 16th century, while European navigators passing by there mentioned it under the name of “ Beautiful Island ”.  The name Formosa was first used in 1542 by Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan, who sighted the island during his circumnavigation of the world. The name Formosa was used by the Spanish, Portuguese, Dutch, and English to refer to the island. The Dutch East India Company (VOC) established a trading post on the island in 1624, and the Dutch formally claimed the island in 1662. The Dutch were expelled from Taiwan in 1662, and the island was ceded to the Qing dynasty in 1683.  The Qing dynasty ruled Taiwan as a province of China until the end of the Chinese Civil War in 1949. The Republic of China (ROC) was established on the mainland in 1912, and after losing the Chinese Civil War, the ROC government fled to Taiwan in 1949. The ROC government has continued to claim sovereignty over Taiwan, but the People's Republic of China (PRC) has asserted sovereignty over the island since the PRC's founding in 1949.  The name Formosa was used by the ROC government to refer to Taiwan, and the name Taiwan was used by the PRC government to refer to the island. column1: French: Un médecin exerçant à l'hôpital pour enfants de Pittsburgh, en Pennsylvanie, a été accusé de meurtre avec circonstances aggravantes après que sa mère ait été retrouvée morte dans le coffre de sa voiture mercredi, selon les autorités de l'Ohio. = English:
column2: A doctor who worked at Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania will be charged with aggravated murder after her mother was found dead in the trunk of her car Wednesday, authorities in Ohio say.
column3: A doctor practicing at a children's hospital in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, has been charged with murder after his mother was found dead in the trunk of her car on Wednesday, according to authorities in Ohio.  Le médecin, qui n'a pas été identifié, a été arrêté à son domicile de Pittsburgh, a indiqué le procureur de l'Ohio, Mike DeWine, dans un communiqué. Il a été transféré à l'Ohio, où il a été accusé de meurtre avec circonstances aggravantes.  Le procureur a indiqué que la mère de l'accusé, Joyce Taylor, de 71 ans, avait été retrouvée morte dans le coffre de sa voiture mercredi, à la frontière entre l'Ohio et la Pennsylvanie. column1: French: Lundi, lors d'une émission de radio sur Sveriges Radio, en Suède, Sara Danius, secrétaire permanente du Comité Nobel de Littérature de l'Académie Suédoise, a annoncé publiquement que le comité, incapable de joindre directement Bob Dylan au sujet du prix Nobel de littérature 2016, avait renoncé à le contacter. = English:
column2: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
column3: On Monday, during a radio show on Sveriges Radio, in Sweden, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Swedish Academy of Literature, announced publicly that the Nobel Prize committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly, had given up trying to contact him.  Danius a expliqué que le comité Nobel avait tenté de joindre Dylan à plusieurs reprises, sans succès. Elle a ajouté que le comité Nobel avait décidé de ne pas lui envoyer un courrier, car il ne voulait pas que le chanteur ne s'en rende compte par la presse. = English: Danius explained that the Nobel Prize committee had tried to reach Dylan several times, without success. She added that the committee had decided not to send him a letter, because he did not want to know about it through the press. column1: French: Les ressources végétales les plus facilement accessibles seraient les protéines contenues dans les feuilles et les légumineuses, mais celles-ci sont difficiles à digérer pour des primates comme nous, à moins d'être cuites. = English:

column1: French: Les insectes ont été les premiers animaux à s'envoler. Leur capacité à voler leur a permis d'échapper plus facilement à leurs ennemis et de trouver plus efficacement de la nourriture et des compagnons. = English:
column2: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently.
column3: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly made it easier for them to escape from their enemies and to find more efficiently food and companions. column1: French: L'hiver peut être trompeusement froid : les températures descendent rarement en dessous de zéro, mais le vent et l'humidité se combinent pour donner l'impression qu'il fait plus froid que ce que dit le thermomètre. = English:
column2: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.

column1: French: Le gouverneur de Californie, Arnold Schwarzenegger, a promulgué une loi qui interdit la vente ou la location de jeux vidéo violents aux mineurs. = English:
column2: California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger signed into law a bill that bans the sale or rental of violent video games to minors.
column3: The governor of California, Arnold Schwarzenegger, has signed a law that prohibits the sale or rental of violent video games to minors.  The law, which was passed by the California State Legislature in September, makes it illegal for retailers to sell or rent violent video games to minors. Violators face fines of up to $1,000.  Violent video games are defined as those that "depict, express or otherwise deal with matters of sex, crime, cruelty, violence or revolting or abhorrent phenomena in such a way that they offend against the standards of morality, decency and propriety generally accepted by reasonable adults to the extent that they should not be classified for sale to minors." column1: French: L'une des méthodes les plus courantes utilisées pour illustrer l'importance de la socialisation est de s'inspirer des quelques cas malheureux d'enfants qui, par négligence, malheur ou abus volontaire, n'ont pas été socialisés par des adultes pendant leur enfance. = English:
column2: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
column3: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to use the few unfortunate cases of children who, through negligence, misfortune or abuse, were not socialized by adults during their childhood.
